stories.text:
At ~10:40 am EDT, we noticed our AWS site to site VPN tunnels were flapping up and down. These included VPNs in multiple AWS regions with connections across multiple ISPs. Downdetector.com and Thousandeyes.com showed an increase in issues for several services around that time.

A few hours later, some tunnels haven't returned to to service and we're experiencing slow connections.

I can not find a single status posting or report confirming an outage.

Is any one else experiencing issues today?
stories.title: Ask HN: Global Internet or AWS Outage?
Cops Try to Hide Body Cam Footage [video]
Klarna’s potential valuation cut to $15B appears sufficiently steep

stories.text:
I've seen a lot of healthy skepticism around web3, and a failure of web3 proponents to provide clear use cases. So I'd like to provide one: a decentralized exchange, or DEX. A DEX is an exchange in which order matching and execution occurs via smart contracts on-chain, rather than through a centralized entity. That gives DEX’s the following advantages over CEX’s: - instant (minutes depending on the chain) and transparent settlement - transparent price discovery - anyone can provide liquidity and receive a percentage of trading fees, rather than just the exchange getting those fees - anyone can list any asset - you can custody your own assets

However, there's a long way to go before DEX's are ready for mainstream use. That will occur when: - most people receive salary and payments directly to their crypto wallets, so no fiat onramp is needed - fees reach parity with CEX's due to L2 improvements - liquidity reaches parity with CEX's - social logins are trusted and/or a there's an optional thin - centralized layer on top of the DEX to help with lost credential recovery - impermanent loss risk can be 0 depending on your risk/return tolerance - DODO PMM seems to have solved this? - robust risk management algorithms minimize the risk of cascading liquidations during high market volatility - chain infrastructure can support millions of TPS during high market volatility

Thoughts? Open-minded skepticism welcome!
stories.title: Prove me wrong – decentralized exchanges are a clear Web3 use case
